intro: Trichosanthes erosa, commonly known as the rough gourd or hairy trumpet vine, is a climbing vine belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, spiny fruits. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, tropical environments. Trichosanthes erosa is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
